title: Lazagne verte
subtitle: Une variation sur le classique, super vibrante et parfumée. Un véritable arrêt sur image.

sections.title: Creamy béchamel sauce
instructions: Now for the green sauce, melt some vegan butter and add kale, spinach, handful of basil & parsley along with some onion and garlic powder in some veg stock
Add to a blender & blitz with peas, garlic, walnuts and of course Nooch
Next our creamy béchamel sauce. Heat in a large pan equal parts vegan butter and flour to form a roux then add soy milk until desired consistency with some Nooch and 1/2 tsp nutmeg

sections.title: Delisious filling and assembly
ingredients: Nutritional yeast to sprinkle on top
instructions: Start by taking a packet of vegan sausages out of their casings.
Fry them off with 1 large white onion, 2 garlic cloves, 1 tsp fennel seeds, and 1 tsp chilli flakes until golden and crispy.
Now for the green sauce, melt some vegan butter and add kale, spinach, a handful of basil, and parsley along with some onion and garlic powder in some veg stock.
Add to a blender and blitz with peas, garlic, walnuts, and nutritional yeast.

Next, prepare the creamy béchamel sauce. Heat in a large pan equal parts vegan butter and flour to form a roux, then add soy milk until desired consistency with some nutritional yeast and 1/2 tsp nutmeg.
Then it’s time to layer it up. Whatever way you want, just make sure to top with béchamel, some nutritional yeast, and whack in the oven at 200°C for about 40-50 minutes.
